text:
Bottle 22fl.oz. @ home. [ As Kern River Citra Double IPA ].Clear medium orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, light pine, light grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, sweet fruit, fruity hops, mango, pineapple, tropical fruit, citrus - grapefruit bitter, sweetness from tropical fruit ala mango - pineapple. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20170413]
 9-3-8-3-17

Pours hazy amber with low white head 
Aromas hoppy of citrusy fruits, grapefruit, pineapple , caramel 
Taste has hoppy notes of citrusy fruits, grapefruit, resin, caramel 
Perfectly balanced dipa with medium body, average carbonated and lingering bitterness

Pours hazy apricot with a low white head. Aromas of ccitrus, peach, apricot, mango, resin. Taste is very fruity and moderately bitter with some grassy notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.  Almost annoyingly well balanced. Awesome!

Bottle shared with koleminer20 for the Koleminer20 Turns 3k and Ebone1988 turns 1.6k Bonanza. Aroma is tropical fruit, pine, slight malt, resin, citrus, great. Appearance is amber golden, slightly hazy, off white head. Taste is tropical fruit, a little malty, pine, resin, a great West Coast IPA example. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, citrus and pine aftertaste. Overall, very enjoyable.

From notes. Enjoyed at a tasting Kyle finally made it to at Mickeys on December 01. 22 oz bottle. The pour is a lighter golden orange yellow color with a thick head of off-white head that slowly falls down to a thick film with a couple good spots of lace. The aroma is nice. The citrus is great. Huge citra hops, light bitterness, great citrus zest, and a surprising crispness. The flavor is much of the same. Big, bright citra hops and a light leafy bitterness. The bitter citrus zest is wonderful and lets this thing do what it is supposed to. The mouth feel is a little syrupy, but brightly carbonated with a lingering citra blast. Im a big fan here.

Draught at the brewery. Pours hazy pale orange with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy dank, fruity and floral hops with peach and apricot esters, nectarines and biscuit malt. Flavor is heavy citrus, dank and floral hops with cracker and biscuit malt, light nectarines and a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

On draft at Caps & Taps. It pours a clear golden color wit a nice off white head. The aroma has passionfruit, lighter notes of grapefruit and some lightly toasted malt. The flavor has the same grapefruit and big passionfruit. Solid toasted malt with a very creamy, oily mouth feel, but dry on the palate. Medium spicy bitterness. A great West Coast IIPA.

650ml bottle from phesterjau, shared by many at Only Child. Thanks Jess! Yellowish orange pour with a white head. Big citra nose. Taste is super smooth citrus with some other fruits. Medium bodied, well blended. Finishes to the bitter side of bittersweet. Very, very smooth and well done. 15

My Bottom Line:
Grapefruit pulp and sandy minerals (cat litter to some) are met by resinous bitterness in this engaging Double IPA.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam circles the hazy beige.
-The fruitiness is pleasant throughout.
-The mouthfeel is soft and effervesncent, quite drinkable for a Double IPA.
-Although this is a perfectly fine Double IPA, I think that their regular Just Outstanding IPA is more pleasant on many fronts.

Bottle.

Bottle courtesy of Jess, thanks a bunch! Pours a honey-orange color. A bit darker than expected. Nice 2 finger head of foam that fades to a ring. Aromas are pretty sweet...cereal grains, honey, rock candy....some peachy hop notes, light tangerine. Taste is pretty sticky sweet with a hefty malt bill. Much heavier on the palate than I expected. I wish the hops were allowed to shine a bit more here. Still, a pretty balanced beer that hides the alcohol fairly well. Finishes with more sticky sweetness that clings to the palate. Not much in the way of hop bitterness...maybe a small alcohol note for some bite, but definitely on the maltier side. Solid beer and glad to have tried it!
22oz. Grapefruit. grassy. hoppy. malt heavy. It doesnt seem as heavy as a double. Decent stuff dont see the top 150 hype, glad I didnt trade for this a year ago when it was much harder to land.

(En fût à la brasserie): Une salade de fruit terriblement équilibrée. Laspect jus est formidable et lamertume presque complètement effacée. Cest un peu déstabilisant, je mattendais à plus spectaculaire. Buvabilité dévastatrice, une candidate ultime pour le cask.
Bottle shared by Bruce. Pours copper with white head. Great citrus aroma. Taste is fresh bitter and citrus. Nice crisp finish.

Bottle shared by my friend Bruce. Pours orange copper with a thick off-white head and a huge citrus aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a grapefruit finish that stay on the palate. Very solid and tasty.

bottle shared at our big bottle share tasting. poured a deep cloudy dark golden colour with a small white head. nose is quite taste. lots of juice fruits, sweet fresh apricots, floral hop notes, tropical fruits, crisp malts, and juicy citrus. taste is not as full bodied as you would expect. sweet fruits forward. slight caramel malts, could have had some more of that hop bitterness in the mouthfeel aswell. clear citra notice. creamy mouthfeel. its clear that the nose is way better than the taste. pretty tasty brew do
Cloudy light amber color. Amazingly dry hopped nose with tons of citrus and grapefruit nose. Very light dry superbly quaffable. Modestly bitter finish. So well put together Southern California beer.
22oz bottle pours out a hazy gold topped with a white head. Nose is heavy citra rich malt heavy hops lots of citrus. Taste is more of citra nice bitter kick and a good grapefruit end.

Tap @ Toronado. Pours hazy amber with a small, frothy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is strongly citrus with hops and vanilla. Flavor is crisp, bitter, with a light flour/wheat favor. Light body and medium carbonation

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at brewery. Heavy citra aroma, heavy citra flavor, lean malt body, a west coast hop bomb masterpiece. Not much else to say.

22 oz bottle shard by Hoff. Thanks, bro. An exciting rare tick by the bro. Pours a nice gently hazed golden amber hue. Frothy whitish head atop is a firmer filmy layer, nice thicker spotty film laces well and sticks around nice enough. Aromas are citric and juicy, touches of tropical fruit, a nice resiny bitter floral life. Grapefruit, mango, pineapple and earth, a bit sweet from the hops. Initial is lighter end of the fold, a nice bitterness, fruity llife, dry and gentle bitter. This never gets sweet or big. Dry and bitter backend, good firm florals with touches of bread, gentle straw. Light, airy, bitter especially as it catches into the backend and finish. While the nose is juicy and rich, a good bubblegum and tropical appeal, the beer is light, the malt body pretty crushable through a bitter backend and finish that comes on nicely. A nice floral slant, touches of earth and citrus rind and oils. Pithy, fresh and tasty. Nice stuff.

Type: 22-oz. bottle
Glass: Pint mug
From: Beer Advocates Toner
Price: N/A
Purchased: N/A; Received on Feb. 18, 2015
Consumed: Feb. 20, 2015
Misc.: N/A

Thanks Tony!

Poured a honey, orange, hazy color with 2-to-3 fingers of khaki-white, rocky head. A few light bubble streams coming up from the bottom of the glass. Good layered, foamy, spiderweb lacing on the sides of the glass. Average retention. (Sight - 4.13)

Wow. First whiff reminded me of an Alpine IPA, specifically Bad Boy or Duet. Got mango, tropical, pineapple, Citra, floral, Amarillo, light resin, grapefruit pulp, nectarine, passion fruit, wet pine, sugary caramel and red grapefruit. Delicious. (Smell - 4.88)

Taste wasnt as potent as the smell, which would be hard to live up to anyway. Got toned down tropical, mango, pineapple, grapefruit pulp, bitter nectarine rind, Citra, some resin, caramel, peach, apricot, slight Juicy Fruit gum, light passion fruit, juice orange, floral and Amarillo. (Taste - 4.38)

Medium body. Creamy texture. Lively carbonation. Long, juicy, bitter finish. (Feel - 4.25)

This was really, really good. However, Ive got yesterdays Hopslam as the wee favorite between the two. Glad I got to try this though. (Overall - 4.38)

4.45 99 A

Tasting with the Crew. Didnt know this badboy was showing up until Jrob21 pulled it out. At 45 days + we had some doubts that it would be as good as the ratings indicate. Would love to try fresh as this was awesome where it was. Tropical fruits, dank, citrus everywhere. Very nice.

Bomber shared with the crew. Was worried this was going to be too old at this point but this is still drinking incredibly right now. I have never had a beer with such a diverse hop experience. Everything from tropical fruit to bubblegum to bitter citrus grapefruit finishes. This has it all along with a good caramel malt working throughout the sip. Ranks up there although a notch below the best.
Bottle pours clear orange and yellow. Aroma is duper fruity and dank hops, really nice. taste is well balanced with a dry fruity bitter finish, really nice double
Bottle sample thanks to some dude at Churchkey. Clear deep golden amber color, white head. Nice aroma of tropical fruit, stone fruit. Taste is bitter and fruity. Very tasty.

Bottle in blind tasting. Pours an orange color with white head. Aroma is citrus and mix of dank. Taste is sweet, dry, dank, citrus, really nice. Like this the more I drink it. This is really nice, but zues is as good and easier to get, awesome beer.
Shared bottle. Pours a somewhat hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and grass. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, tropical, pine, grass, and malt. Excellent.

Bottle. Poured into big snifter. Nose is pungent grass and typical Citra dankiness. I could smell this all day. Pour is a hazy orange with a small white head. Taste is moderately tropical with a pineapple and melon flavor. Very light malt presence, just a little breadiness. Moderately firm bitterness at first but definitely builds as I drink it. No detectable alcohol and very quenching. Could stand just a bit mor carbonation for the mouthfeel and to break it up. Very nice.

22oz, thanks D! Clean orangey golden, ample head that settles. Sweaty, pithy, hints of lemon and pineapple, dry white pepper. Light body, crackery dryness, hints of bitter citrus meld with the hops to really make this beer balanced and easy drinking for 8%.

Pours a hazy, golden color; fluffy white head with excellent retention and fine-bubbled lacing; tiny bubbles, beautiful pour. Loads of dry, grassy and herbal hop character in the aroma; nicely resiny and dry; dank; strongly reminiscent of herb. Medium-to-full body: creamy, softly textured mouthfeel despite the lively carbonation.

Enjoyed at the 2014 Firestone Walker Invitational. Hazy yellow, like fresh-squeezed lemon. Aroma displays lovely citrus/grass character, while the flavor adds a resinous, juicy hop quality. Very good, but not mind-blowing.

22oz bomber pours with an opaque deep gold body that has copper hues and supports a white head of foam. The aroma offers up sweet tangelo, clementine and tart pithy grapefruit aromatics. Wow, inviting smell. The taste is bold with tangelo and clementine citrus notes that are heavy with bitter hops and also smooth with modest malt sweetened tangelo hop flavor. It ends refreshing and fairly dry. This is solid hoppy brew with plenty of rich citrusy hoppiness.

this was originally up there (though below) Pliny and Pliny as my favorite of the IIPA fest. Its citrus rind sweet and bitter goodness stood up to the biggest and best...we even went back for seconds. not all hops, but not exactly balanced, its bright and fragrant aroma and taste were great. i;d buy bottles if i ever saw em. lower ibus (75) than most or all at the fest, but more flavor. Not quite as much of a WOW beer bottled, but pretty damn nice."
Draft at Mudville 9 NYC. Pours a light tan color. Crisp easy drinking not overly hoppy beer. Goes down easy for a 2x iPa

Huge huge thanks to a generous patron at CK! Pretty, vibrant peach pour, hazy, with a solid fluffy white head. Nose and flavor are glorious, with apricot, pineapple, dank lemongrass and chinotto peel resonating throughout the palate. Not an ounce of sweetness or malt. Clean, bitter, and medium to high effervescence. Beautifully done.

range brown opaque pour with small but dense white foam. Aroma is a blast of tropical fruits, lots of pinneaples, mango and oranges. Also some of the distinctive cat pee and wet grass from citra hops. Taste is also very fruity, some resin with definite bitterness without being over the top. Could have a little more carbonation. The perfect example of the fruity IIPA.
Had on tap at the brewery back in March during release. Great floral & citrus aroma. Wonderful DIPA. Wish I could have it more often.

Taster at Beer Temple, Chicago. Light golden. Aroma is Citra hops, muted fruits. Taste is a little faded - fruit especially, plenty of resinous finish though. Good, but would live to drink this on draft.

Draft at the brewery this weekend, multiple pours! Aroma is sticky grapefruit, passionfruit, mango, light pineapple, dank herbs, twiggy, resin, citrus. Last years bottle aroma was a lot less pungent, and had more stone fruit like peach, but the draft version is still pretty fruity. The beer pours a cloudy deep golden color with orange highlights and moderate white head. The retention is medium and the lacing eventually gets washed away with each sip. Taste is extremely tropical with lots of pineapple, guava, mango and orange peel. Towards the back of the tongue more citrus arrives with moderate earthy bitterness, citrus peels, resiny. Body is medium-light with medium-high carbonation and a pretty dry finish. Moderate alcohol warmth, low alcohol bite and low astringency. After taste is slightly vegetal with some leaves and twigs; however each sip brings back so much citrus its more of an afterthought. The bottle version last year didnt have that on the palate and was juicier, creamier with a lot more tropical fruit on the after taste. Overall the 2014 version was still pretty darn delicious with light creamy body, medium dank hop note and lots of tropical fruit and citrus. I drank 2 pints easily and contemplated a third. Now Im craving that third. Dammit.

65cl, no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2010, thx alot to Peter for bringing this over!, complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly malty/floral, very balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew

22oz bottle. What I love most about this beer is how well balanced it is. So many fruit and floral arroma I can?t keep tabs. Tastes of citrus, pineapple,grapefruit, and mango. Finishes like a fruit smoothie with hops. Great beer!

Sample at The Bistro DIPA-Festival, February 8. (my first one from this brewery)

Hazy golden with a white head. Hops, grass, pine and citrus. Very refreshing and nicely drinkable. Bitter finish. A nice one.

Had this quite a while ago, but it is still the single best DIPA I have ever had. The nose was beautiful, with tons of tropical fruit. The flavor was almost as good.. 

Nothings perfect, but this is pretty darn close.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2014 Bottle: This is based off of the February 2013 release. Bright gradient of colors, ranging from goldenrod to dense amber with a haziness cascading throughout. A big, chunky white head rests on top & leaves great lacing as it travels down the glass. One of the best aromas you can get from an IPA. Mango, pineapple, guava, grapefruit, apricot, peach, tangerine, some sticky passion fruit... Fruit orgy, backed up by a lightly dank & resinous hop profile with plenty of sticky, dripping hop oils. Light pine & resin with nice pungency & just a touch of green onion in the finish. Taste is amazing as well. Another tropical & citric fruit explosion; citrus, pineapple, mango, grapefruit, honeydew, passion fruit... you name it. Nice lupulin oil background with some lightly dank & pine-y hops. Malt is very light with a touch of bready biscuits to back up the hop assault. Very dry & never too sweet. Lovely on all accounts.

Bottle. 11/17/13. Pours gold with a thin, but dense white head. Aroma is crisp, clean, fresh, fruity, citrus, pine, pineapple, peach, bitter fruit rind; fantastic. Taste is fruity, juicy, clean, fresh, grapefruit, citrus, very well balanced; finish is lasting grapefruit rind. Lacing throughout. Medium carbonation. Full bodied. Just excellent; delicious.

Hazy bright orange color, thin white head. Juicy aroma of mango, peach, orange, passionfruit, and grapefruit. Perfect amount of sweetness, giving way to hop bitterness in the finish. A little too much carbonation, but overall crisp and refreshing. Alcohol content is well hidden by the hop bitterness.

Pours a hazed pastel orange with a melon hue. Unique and pleasant color. A fat head of cottony foam that will not fall down. Dont bother to wait. Leaves spectacular cotton candy lace. There are plenty of bubbles rising to the surface. The nose is simply terrific. Tropical fruits. Pineapple, mango, Grapefruit, orange and lemon citrus, candied fruit peel. A sweet floral and a succulent hop sweetness. The malt promises some sweetness but doesnt smell heavy or sugary. Taste is splendid. Grapefruit comes to the front of the palate bringing a hop punch of juicy fruit flavors with it. The body of the beer is soft and while amply carbonated its supple and smooth. The malt teases you with a bit of flaky biscuit that is not too sweet. 

This beer is simply the lightest DIPA I have ever had. The malt is vibrant in and of itself and the flaky biscuit quality has its sweetness in the bread and not from sugar. The hops are graceful and abundant but not oily or resiny or even too piney. The fruits were simply stated in their own right. As many as there were I could name them all thats how well done they are. Grapefruit is an engaging taste and this one lets all the other exotic fruits stand behind its grapefruit. Not too much pith but just enough to accent a dazzling little bitter that steals the show from any sugary sweetness you think you are about to taste. You can believe the hype about this one. Its straight forward and well turned out. A pleasure to drink ! Thank you Richard!

There are times in your life when you are blown away by the generosity of some Ratebeerians. This is one of those times. Thank you IrishBoy for the opportunity to try this beer. Bottle. Pours hazy golden amber with a small creamy off-white head that slooooowly dissipates leaving nice lacing. Aroma is certainly citra - passionfruit, pine resin, cat piss, grapefruit. Flavor is the same, juicy. Lightly sweet and surprisingly light bitterness - these hops are going into flavor, not bittering. Medium body, oily mouthfeel. No detectable presence of that 8% ABV - it really sneaks up on you. This is the kind of IPA I am growing to love most - not overly bitter, but full of fruity, juicy hop goodness. Right up there with Exponential and Heady as one of the best. Now I am just bummed that I only have maybe 8 oz left in my glass as I write this. I cant imagine when I will get to try it again. Shit. 6 ounces.

Bomber from trade with dogday. Huge thanks! Just released about a week ago. Pours a cloudy orange color with a big frothy head that fades slowly and never completely goes away. Musty, pungent citra hops in the aroma which gives off a huge citrus, floral, and tropical fruit scent. Taste is just delicious. Medium sweetness with a strong bitterness. Fresh citra hop taste. Smooth bitter finish, very light dryness. Medium body, light oiliness in the mouthfeel. Spectacular DIPA. Citra hops are my favorite and this is just awesome. Like a more intense Zombie Dust.
On draft at KRBC Citra release. Massive grapefruit aroma! Lots of citrus notes on the palate, fused with some earthy grass funk. Amazing brew!

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, Thick White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Grapefruit, Pineapple, Mild Malts

T: Grapefruit, Sweet Malts

M: Great Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Somewhat Citrusy, Semi Drying

Overall, a really solid Citrusy DIPA with a great nose and decent taste, very drinkable...
Rojiza opaca con corona beige densa y persistente. Aroma resina y mucha malta caramelo, frutos rojos. En boca gran complejidad dulce,

cloudy yellow ,smooth white head. 
flowery and citrussy hoppy aroma. 
flavor is citrussy hoppy, sweet fruity hoppy, good malty balance

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 22oz bottle in a tulip.  Pours cloudy amber/orange with a lacy, cream-colored head.  Aroma strong of citrusy hops, some pineapple, caramel and pale malts, and light doughiness.  Flavor the same with a lot of citrus and tropical fruits.  Smooth texture.  A really good double IPA.
Pours with minimal head into my Hill farmstead taster.  Orange towards amber color.  Big juicy pineapple on the aroma.  Love this beer!

Poured from a 22oz bomber into a HF taster. Pours a golden opaque orange with a slight white head. Scent is heavy floral with pineapple, mango, and grapefruit... Really awesome. Taste is again with the pineapple and grapefruit and a nice hop bitterness. Medium body with a dry finish. Fantastic.

Hazy gold with no head. Aroma of bitter grapefruit and malt. Taste is bitter and malty, lots of citrus. Very crisp and citrusy, really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber shared by jegross...thanks Jeff! - Pours cloudy light amber with a thin white head. Nose is big and dank Citra, real oniony with a pit of pine. Mellow bready malt on the backbone. Taste is more mellow than youd think given the smell and the ABV. Its pretty hoppy, but the backing malt mellows it out. Finishes with Citra and pine, but its not terribly pungent or bracing in the mouth--just smooth. The body is soft, too, and its well carbonated. I could drink steins of this.

Bomber shared by Cheff Scott, Thanks Duder! Split into two snifters, cloudy yellow orange with a light frothy white head, a little more than a finger. Nose is really solid, pineapple, orange, papaya, citrus romp.. Taste is really balanced, which comes as a surprise, I was thinking this was going to be hop bomb based on location + limitation of release. Not so, not bad though, medium-low mouthfeel, excellent carbonation. Dry finish v. the oily finish of most DIPAs out there, again not a bad thing. Take home message; I would drink this beer all the time it was available, but for being so limited it kind of over-hypes it for me.

Thanks to Aaron for this gem. Golden orange with a two finger, tight and pure white head. One of the prettiest beers I have ever seen. Aromas are wonderful. Tropical fruits, melon, grapefruit and stone fruits. Soft bitterness finishes with a nice honey malt sweetness. Nice carbonation. Amazing beer. Glad I was able to try it!!!
Mmmm, Citra! Crisp, clean, refreshing, full of hops, so malty and delicious. One of the very best DIPAs made anywhere.

22oz courtesy of Dale.

A: Cloudy straw color with a thin white head. Great legs.

N: Lots of grapefruit. Lots of earth and pine. Very little malt.

T: Very citrusy. Lots of pineapple and grapefruit. Great malt base, but it has the stinging sugariness I associate with some underattenuation. Tons of earth and pine. Nice.

M: Medium bodied and quite sticky. Noticeable alcohol.

O: Quite good, but I wouldnt kill myself for more.

Botella. Deeo golden colour, small white head. Sweet like quite fruity herbal hoppy caramel aroma. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, exotic like fruity, herbal with citrus, caramel and a good bitterness.

Thank u liquidjo

Bottle poured into my three clouds pint glass.  Immediately on pour, a big burstvof tropical fruit, mangos and pineapple nose.  Taste is smooth, hoppy, citrus and fruit filled from the abundance of citra hops.  One of the juicyest ipas I have tried.  Overall this was towards the top of the list of IPA I have had.  Amazing

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2013 Buttery, malty aroma with tropical citra. Flavor is tropical fruits, medium bitterness, round malt backbone, lingering bitter finish. Solid but there are better citra-oriented beers.

Draft during SF Beer Week. Fresh hop aromas and flavors, filled with herbs, citrus and florals. The balance was the most impressive part. Big, yet balanced. Subtle, yet bold. Great, easy drinking texture. Needed to warm a bit to fully express itself. Worth the hour wait. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Aroma is all fruity hops. Lots of bright citrus but with a well balanced tropical fruit and peach note. There is no malt aroma or alcohol in the nose. Just bright, clean hops. This beer isnt pretty. Its not at Heady Topper levels but it is very cloudy - you can tell through the bottle. Pours orange with a big white head that has nice retention and good lacing. A slight, sweet malt note up front but then the flavor is all hops just like the aroma. Lots of fruit in the hop profile - citrus, tropical fruit and peach. A touch of a melon character a well. Nice clean but assertive bitterness. Dry, bitter finish with a hint of alcohol spice. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, approaching medium light. Medium carbonation with very low astringency, just a bit of hop astringency. Medium low alcohol warmth. Overall this is a really nice, bright, fruity DIPA. Clean alcohol and malt notes that dont distract from the hops. I dont know that this is really worth the lengths people go through though. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Papsø. Pours a hazy golden color with a longlasting white head. has a fruity grassy citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Clloudy yellow/amber - white head. Grassy, dusty hops, toasted, overripe fruits, herbal, milkey notes, grainy, light citra hoppy, wierd, boring and old.

Bottle at Papsø.
Hazy orange coloured with a medium sized white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and grass.
Fruity flavour of hops, pine needles and grass.
Dry hoppy finish.

22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy, grapefruity and citrusy. Peachy, mango and passion fruit. Mellow, smooth fruity and only gently bitter. Lingering fruity finish.
Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma has notes of straw, lemons, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, straw, and hops, leading to a bitter finish.
Bottled. Amber coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. Aroma: Herbs, flowers, caramel. Flavour: Fruits, flowers, caramel, citrus. Medium to full bodied. Ends citric and flowery bitter.

Bottle 65 cl. Courtesy of Doodler. Pours a cloudy deep golden with a creamy and lacing off-white head. Fresh and juicy, citrusy hops. Medium body, heavy sweet fruitiness, quite malty with a bitter finish. Not overly fresh and crispy. 221112

Tap at Toronado SD. Pours a bright, low haze, light orange. Small, white head. Nose is heavier butterscotch, vanilla, some vodka, mango, parmesan cheese. Taste is boozy/white alcohol/vodka, butterscotch. Palate is thick, chewy, oily. A bit sticky/syrupy. Not what I was expecting.

Massive citrus aroma.  Mostly grapefruit - hint of orange.  Light golden with light small head.  Taste is almost entirely grapefruit.  Super citrusy, not balanced at all, but done extremely well.  Like grapefruit juice with a massive hop kick!

This is my first review in a WHILE! Im now going to start reviewing in my own format and not worry about the Appearance, Smell, Taste, Mouthfeel, & Overall "Format" Ive used so boringly in the past. Leggo

Bottle came from a trade with HoppySuds (in person in CA) and I shared this 22oz brew with my cousin Mark in a tasting held at my new house in Benton Park.  This was one of the few (besides D4) that we finished the whole bottle during the tasting.  There was no markings on the bottle of any bottling date. 

The appearance was made up of a big, long lasting 1 and 1/2 finger head that was very frothy with bubbles. Had a deep orange/copper colored body with slight hazing.  Left great lacing behind. 

In the aroma, tons of fruit, hops, and mango are all thrown hard.  Very great and appropriate for this Double hopped up IPA.

Flavor? Big Hopped (American variety), Fruity, and has a Medium-High bitterness level.  Not too much complexity.

The mouthfeel starts with a medium to high body is well pronounced with hop.  Medium carbonation and finishes with TONS of citra, hence the name.

Cheers to this one! Not sure Id throw it onto one of the top 10 beers of popular category but it was damn good.  Would like to see another bottle of this in my future.  Go for it!

22 oz. bottle served in a CBS snifter. From the recent bottling. Huge, Huge, Huge thanks to SupoenaDeuces for this bottle. Thanks Alex!!

A: Pours a perfect hazy orange color with a fluffy pure white head forming on the pour. The retention is out of this world and as the head slowly subsides it leaves huge, sticky sheets of lace behind. 

S: Pineapple flesh, sweet caramel malts, light grass and light lemon grass. Extremely balanced.

T: The taste follows the nose perfectly. Citrus pineapple and orange with a touch of lemon peel. Sweet caramel malts and light bitter hops on the finish.

M: This is the most drinkable DIPA Ive ever had. So smooth and balanced. It drinks like water. Nice solid carbonation with a medium to light body.

O: One the most balanced DIPAs Ive had and certainly the most drinkable. The wonderful citrus flavors with the sweet caramel are just perfect. Not to mention the beer looks pretty too.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-05-2012

Bouteille. Bière orangée avec une mousse blanche. Le nez est composé de citron, le houblon Citra oblige. Le malt supporte bien cette dose de houblon. En bouche le houblon attaque tout ce qui bouge, il transperce le malt.  Il y a du citron, des agrumes, du savon, de la gomme à mâcher Thrills. Cest superbe comme bière. Digeste, agréable comme la compagnie de Patrick, Julien et Pierre-Luc qui nous ont partagé cette bière. Merci.

Une bombe houblonnée offerte par Julien et Pier-Luc.  Merci les gars!  Un regard élégant avec sa robe orangée et sa mousse collante.  Un nez fabuleux de fruits tropicaux assez juteux.  Définitivement un fond floral qui rencontre des herbes folles.  Une instance maltée qui rend grâce à la magie opérée par le Citra.  Un goût qui napporte que du bonheur à mes papilles.  Des agrumes et de lananas dans un jus pulpeux de mangues et de pêches.  Une bouche bien construite avec un apport de bulles plus que convenable et une texture bien huileuse.  Une finale de fruits tropicaux qui sétendent sur un très long moment.  Une bière aromatique et savoureuse qui possède une grande buvabilité.

Bottle. Cloudy gold pour with white head. Beautiful citra aroma, really pungent, thick and fruity, lemon peel, pineapple. Taste is bitter, citrus peel, tons over tons of fruity hop flavors. Well carbed with medium body. Simply delicious.

Pours a nice orange color with nice frothy white head, good lacing down the glass. Smell is nice juicy grapefruit and orange with a slight piney smell in there.  Taste is much the same very citrusy with a bit of pineapple.  Medium bodied beer with good amount of carbonation.  This double IPA is world class.

22oz bottle pours a clear orange with some creamy white head.  Nose is pine, grapefruit, earthy, sweet.  Flavor is sweet, earthy, pine.  Medium bodied, sweet, earthy finish.  Not sure what the hype is all about, this was fairly pedestrian in my opinion.

Surprise bomber from Richard.  Damn dude, thanks!  Pours out an orange color with a white head on it.  Smell is loaded with mango, pineapple, and other citrus notes.  I have never had anything made with Citra before.. Taste is great, smooth, fruity, no alcohol bite.  Plenty of carbonation, basically a perfect double IPA.  Fantastic beer; can I get some more?

22 oz. bottle shared by bsuedekum- thanks again, Blake! Long-time want. Pours a hazy gold color with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, herbal and resinous notes, and sweet malts. Flavor of citrus, tropical fruits, pine resin, caramel malts, vanilla, and bread. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a sweet, resinous mouthfeel. A little disappointing. Just doesnt pop like I thought it would. Still a nice DIPA.

22oz bottle, 8/2012 release, fresh as can be. pours a gorgeous, hazy gold and sits the color of peach skin the glass capped by a rich,creamy, white head that leaves sticky sheets of lace. aroma is outstanding with huge tropical fruit notes of apricot, mango, pineapple, and starfruit backed by dank grass, pine resin, and pear syrup with a hint of sweet honeybun as it opens up. flavor is where this brew really shines as it brings an amazing blast of tropical fruit notes including pineapple, mango, guava, kiwi, and nectarine and balances them with resinous, piney bitterness, wet grass, and a hint of crackery malts. palate is medium bodied with creamy carbonation and a juicy mouthfeel from all the tropical fruits that finishes dry, fruity, and lightly bitter. overall, and outstanding dipa that lives up to the hype.

A: Hop-hazed gold color with a frothy white cap. Excellent retention

S: You can smell this beer as soon as you open the cap. Massive tropical fruit (mango/pineapple) blasts your face. A touch of resin. Delicate yet sturdy malt background to balance. Perfect

T: Ahhh man, tons of tropical fruit and a light malt backing. Balanced perfectly for a dipa. Kind of similar to sculpin but with aore pungent hop attack

MF: Smooth and velvety feel to it. Carbonation is low-medium and doesnt ruin the experience like other dipas have a tendency of doing. Alcohol is well hidden throughout

O: I absolutely love this beer. This is the benchmark of dipas in my opinion (move over Pliny)

Thanks to drabmuh for splitting his growler with me.

A: Very hazy yellow/orange with an excellent, thick head and awesome retention and lacing.

S: As soon as the growler opened, the hop aromas began arousing my palate. A gargantuan aroma, and probably the most robust scents I have found in a DIPA. Enticing grapefruit and mango. Go citra hops!

T: Delicious. It doesnt taste quite as amazing as it smells, but its pretty tasty nonetheless. This beer is hops, hops, hops. What a fabulous blend of citrus flavors. Forget balance, give me an insanely hopped, delicious, refreshing, well crafted DIPA. Kern has delivered.

M: Very pleasant bitter finish. Very nice.

D: A fine brew I look forward to having again. Its easy to throw back a few pints of Citra DIPA. Highly recommended.

Managed to grab a growler of this through a recent trade. Thanks. Beer is yellow and light in color but completely hazy. Carbonation is moderate which is good since its a growler. There is a lot of lacing on the glass from the white head of small to medium bubbles. Looks nice.

From the first moment I started pouring this beer, the aroma knocked me down. Seriously, it is one of the best smelling beers I have ever smelled. Complex fruit salad of peaches and pineapple and mango. Its the citra hops that give it such a floral and complex aroma, Im now thinking about making a line of air fresheners that use citra hops. Amazing.

Like most west coast IPAs this is not a malt bomb. It is relatively light on the tongue, lots of carbonation stimulates the midpalate and focuses your attention on the fruitish flavors of this beer. It doesnt start out too bitter but it gets you there pretty quickly. Bitterness definitely grows over the course of the beer, no aftertaste though, just lingers. Drinkability is high, not as high as a few other DIPAs but its up there. Its a great example and experiment in the potential hops have on the overall character of a beer. I would recommend this in a heartbeat and would definitely have it again.

22oz bomber poured orange somewhat mildly cloudy to just hazy...just a sampler of this one...big citrus aroma lots of different fruits going on...hard to distinguish them all..seems almost jumbled at times. but the one flavor i got from this was bubble gum. almost like bazooka bubble gum...other than that pretty decent.

22 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy orange with a medium white frothy head. Aroma of pungent tropical fruits in the way of pineapple and mango, some floral notes and piney hops. Flavour of pungent tropical fruits: mango and pineapple, with lots of piney hops, floral notes, dried fruits (apricots), with a well-malted bready malt backing with slight sweetness. Finishes dry, tropical fruity, bready and only lightly sweet. Extremely well-balanced and crafted all-round. Most excellent.

66cl Bottle at AHBS. Hazy golden yellow colour, white head. Aroma of orange lemonade, sweet, fruity, pineapple, pine. Flavour is dry, fresh, light pine, citrus, crackers, dry citrus bitter finish. Light to medium bodied. Very nice and refreshing.

Bottle courtesy of vin. Pours a bright orange with one inch white, fluffy head. Aroma is fresh citrus hop, grapefruit. Mouthfeel is so refreshing, flavors are much more tropical then the aroma suggests; notes of orange, apricot, grapefruit, lemons, and citrus hops.
Excellent citrusy aroma. Nice, cloudy orange color common to good ipas. Sweet on the nose, yielding to a gentle grapefruit flavor and a slightly bitter finish.

Bottle @ Dans house, courtesy of arminjewell. Thanks amigo! Pretty clear, fluorescent orange appearance with a white head. Potent grapefruit citrusy, light ganja, a touch resins, floral hoppy aroma. Rich grapefruit creamy, orange citrusy, a bit piney ganja hoppy flavor with a lingering dry finish. Nice beer.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, thanks to Hopseeker!  Hazy orange-yellow pour with nice fluffy 3-4 fingers of white head, aroma brought notes of big tropical fruit with big pineapple, mango, touch of grapefruit, and passionfruit notes, hints of orange but a nice floral and pine note in there, hints of caramel and biscuit to back but this is all about the hops.  Taste is nice fruity hops with some mango, pineapple, touch of biscuit and bread, slight floral and fruity notes, touch of slight spice, finishing fairly bitter but the sweetness of the hops counteracts it well.  Nothing crazy or over the top but very well made.

Large, white rocky head that lasts and leaves plenty of lace behind. Initial pour was a lightly hazy blond color. Final pour got a lot hazier. Nice fruity nose with notes of pineapple and citrus. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation, lil oily on the palate, light resinous notes. Fruity hop flavors, citrus, tropical, melony notes with hints of pencil shavings, cedar and light peaches. Fairly juicy and enjoyable. Lightly sweet finish with a tame hop bite. Surprisingly tame for a west coast Dipa. Bomber from IrishBoy, thanks Richard!

Bomber shared by the guys at the Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours hazy darkish gold. Mixed resin/citrus aroma. Smooth flavor thats about the same. Theres lush fruitiness, and a large amount of hop. Extreme, but not burning, hop level in the finish. Excellent.

In short: A bittersweet fruity (mangos + tropical fruits) IPA.  Very good even if a bit sweet
How: Bottle 22oz.  Consumed fresh a few weeks after purchase and quickly sent to me by Alen, thanks a lot Alen
The look: Cloudy dark blonde ale topped by a medium white head with good retention
In long: Nose has plenty of mangos, some other tropical fruits, some cat urine (I get that from most IPAs that make heavy use of Citra) and some light notes of pine-tree.  Taste is bready pale malts, residual sugars, a bit of bubblegum, dried fruits, tropical fruits.  Bitterness level is only medium.  Very tasty.  Unfortunately the after-taste has a little too much residual sugars.  As of this writing the two heavyweights of the blonde Citra Double IPA sub-genre is this one and the Hill Farmstead Double Citra.  They both have a very similar flavor profile but I find that the Hill Farmstead is more aromatic, has a more pronounced fruitiness and feels a little less sweet.  Still, this Ken River is a very good beer, almost excellent.  Yet another top-rated Californian IPA, so I guess what you guys are saying is that they make great hoppy beers in California no kidding tell me something I dont already know.  Like how to behave like a responsible adult for instance.

Super Fresh Bottle. 420th rating, fitting beer. Enjoyed this beauty with my brother on Easter Sunday while watchin the Masters. Pours an ultra cloudy and hazy orange, lively carbonation, medium white head with tons of tiny bubbles. Soapy and thick lacing. Aromas of tangerine, fresh pine, tropical fruits, oak, cantalope melon, light notes of fresh baked biscuit, earthy and caramel malt. Taste is buttery tropical citrus infusion of kiwi, pineapple, mango, grapefruit, and some cocconut milk. Perfect amount of bitter in the finish. Had some white oak jai lai characteristic but way juicier and more balanced. Not as sweet. Incredible.

DIPA heaven right here.  Based on the aroma I was preparing to be dissapointed.  Most IPAs that use copious amounts of citra have that huge tropical fruit aroma but this was muted.  The taste more then made up for it though.  Massive tropical fruits with medium sweetness and a sweet yet crisp finish.  Love this hop and this beer.
Very pleasant ipa. Thanks to shinbone! Big hop flavors, sweetness, and bitterness is abruptly perfectly.

Courtesy of hopseeker via trade.
Bottle:  The aroma consists of citrus, tropical fruits, peach, grapefruit, and a hint of lemon.  It pours a hazy orangish-gold with some very fine sediment and a two finger creamy white head with decent retention and some soapy webbing for lacing.  The flavor starts with moderate tropical fruits with some hints of sweet orange.  The finish has moderate grapefruit, light orange peel, and a touch of pine.  Its medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.  Overall...I drank this following the 5th Anniversary.  They are very similar and both dangerously drinkable, but the Citra has more bitterness/grapefruit in the finish than the 5th Anniversary...and because of that, I like it just a tad more.  Kern River sure seems to make some incredibly "sessionable"  IIPAs.

22 oz bottle.  Foggy orange with a billowy white head.  Nose is pineapple, mango, white pepper and cannabis.  Thick and juicy, hops adding spice and bite but not much bitterness.  Taste is mango, candied grapefruit peel, blood orange and spruce.  Hints of mint finishing with clam juice (?).  Delicious.

30 mar 2012, bottle. Yellow, faintly cloudy. Slightly sweet white grapefruit juice aroma. Thin/med body and mildly fizzy. Grapefruit juice citrus. Not much malt but just a tad do its not too thin or bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy orange with a nice head. Smell and taste are both citrusy and flowery with a nice hop kick. Very nice.

Pours a rather hazy, copper color with a nice head that sets up and stays. Aroma of citrus and hops. Flavor is a very nice combination of citrus and pine-hops thats not too bitter. Theres an underlying sweetness. One of the best.

Bottle provided by Jenray .. . Pours a deep tan caramel .. . awesome foam .. lacing is like a 5year found a glue bottle .. . 100 acres of fresh cut trees, sap, sticky flowers, and resin .. . nice mouth, sticky and pleasing .. . an awesome brew!! .. . . Were in a warehouse, and you just hit a cow. I think we better back up.

From notes.  First reviewed 12/5/2010.  Poured from a freshly opened growler -- bottled 4 days ago -- into a tulip. 

Citra pours a pleasant orange tangerine color, a bit hazy with a fluffy white head that levels off at 3cm that retains nicely and leaves a ton of lacing all over the glass. 

A ton of citra hops in the nose, very nice. Peach, apricot, mango, passion fruit, grapefruit, and orange blossoms as well. 

The pale malt up front provides a bit of sweetness and really just lets the hops shine through. As the aroma would suggest, there is a ton of juicy citrus here. Passion fruit, mango, grapefruit, with some floral notes as well. Finishes lightly bitter.

That wonderful well-crafted creamy IPA feel. Fuller than medium carbonation, juicy, a bit sticky at the end, all wrapped in a medium body.

I feel really fortunate that I was able to try this one out. Great, straight forward flavor, a bucket of hops, and a great feel make this one I would like to have more often.

Smells of citra hops and straw, very grassy with some bright citrus fruit, slightly malty and very balanced. Taste is grassy and bitter, pale malts but not sweet, some orange and tropical fruit hops in the finish. Medium bodied with a medium light carbonation. A very drinkable IPA.

Really excited for this growler!

A - pours a hazy orange amber with a pillowy white head that recedes but never goes away. my pint glass is covered in webbing.

S - FRESH! Oily hops, oranges, peach, light caramel malt, and more delicious grapefruit.

T - Carbonated oily grapefruit juice. Its fresh and full of sweet fruit courtesy of its namesake hop. Did I say fresh hops yet? I <3 you citra.

M/D - Even this growler after only a few hours in the fridge has great body and carbonation. I will have no problem killing this growler sans a pint for my roommate. The overall balance of fruit hops to light malt with a very well masked abv makes this one of my favorite DIPAs.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 11-11-2010

Citra DIPA pours a cloudy, hazy, deep orange color.  A nice two finger head is poured but dies down to what you see in the picture to the right and just sticks there.  Lacing all throughout the glass as you enjoy this nectar.

Wow is all I had to say to myself when I popped this growler open.  I was afraid that maybe the beer lost some of its greatness in the trip across the country but hell no.   This is one of the best smelling beers Ive ever had.  You get blasted and I mean blasted by fruit.  Citrus and other tropical fruits.  Pineapple, grapefruit, mango, etc.  Just amazing.  Luckily there is a small malt backbone here to keep things in check.  Doesnt matter though.  The smell is out of this world and its full of hops.  I want to take a damn bath in this beer.

With some beers your all psyched when you have a fantastic smell and then you try that first taste and youre disappointed.  Not here.  This beer blew me away.  Up front you get blasted once again by hops.  Fruity.  Just plain citrus and other fruits.  Amazing.  But the beer also has a rawness to it.  A freshness that is hard to explain.  The hops are just so pronounced.  You can tell this beer was dry hopped a ton.  Theres a also a nice bitterness to this brew but its not overwhelming.  A biscuit like malt background is present but gets blasted by the hops.

Mouthfeel was pretty much spot on too.  Carbonation was great even after the long trip.  Medium bodied and slick.

First off, this beer was enjoyed at an EPIC stout tasting (KtG, BT, BA Speedway, DL, Jackie Os BA DA, etc...) and this was probably the best beer we had that night. Its just outrageously delicious.

A: Hazy dark citrus orange in color with a nice white bubbly head that fades to a nice layer of foam on the surface. The color makes me want to bathe in it. So beautiful 

S: This stuff should be sold to beer geeks as a sexual pheromone. The aroma on this is just outrageous! First pop of the cap and the waft of tropical/exotic fruits and hops hits your nose immediately. This is a full on aromatic assault of citrus, mangoes, peaches, grapefruit, pineapple and some resinous hoppy citrus hops. Holy shit this stuff smells like sex in a bottle. 

T&M : Not surprisingly, the flavor follows the nose almost to a tee. A full on mouthgasm of hoppy citrus flavors, mangoes, peaches, pineapple, orange, and enough malt backbone to perfectly compliment everything. The malt backbone almost has a honey like quality but in no way is sweet like honey. Beautiful. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, yet crisp and amazingly refreshing. This is highly, HIGHLY drinkable. This beer is liquid art. 

O: I dont even know what to say. I think the brewer stumbled upon one of the greatest DIPA recipes known to man. Everything about this is damn near perfect in every way. I cant recommend this highly enough. Its definitely in my top 5 as of right now.

22oz bottle, no date from Beverages 4 Less for $9.99.  Cant believe I havent rated this wonderful beer, from the first time I had it just before the Bistro DIPA fest a couple years ago--must be lost in one of many notebooks somewhere.  Medium orange with some golden highlights and a two finger, well-retained off-white head.  Passionfruit is up front in the nose with some sweet cotton candy, tinge of alcohol.  Digging slightly deeper I get some green dry hopped notes, and some ripe sweet orange.  Flavor continues with the tropical fruit and sweet cotton candy hop combo that I enjoy so much, though the hops seem slightly restrained.  Pretty moderate sweetness doesnt seem to be tempered incredibly well by the hops, though there is some effort.  The finish is semi-dry with bitterness peaking at a 4-5. I always complain about too much bittering, but I feel this batch couldve used a touch more with the amount of sweet malt. Full body with light to moderate carbonation.  I know my original rating hangs around a 4.4-4.5, so Im blending the two.  Glad Kyle and the gang are still doing kickass beers!
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Bottle. Thanks to Secret Santa. Pours hazy golden with a small lasting creamy head and lacings.  Orange, lemon and pineapple. Dry and bitter. Slightly oily. Citra no question but also some orange and some other hop. Not sure this is entirely fresh or perhaps it is just the mix of Citra and Amarillo?.  Not sweet malty but some caramel and more malty than expected. Tasty nevertheless. Smooth and dry finish.

Bottle; Pour is murky medium gold with a nice, medium bubbled off white head in this glass. Light, spotty lacing is present here. The nose is pungent pine and citrus notes, with a clear modest malt backbone. The flavor profile is bitter pine and grapefruit, sweet caramel malts, but heavy on the bitter notes while adding a touch of cream from the head of this one - I was expecting more depth out of this one - Loved it - but I was expecting more depth. Whoops

Bottle shared by brew3crew. Poured clear copper color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy spruce citrus hop aroma. Moderate to heavy bitter flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. Medium to full body with a slick texture and soft carbonation and soft alcohol bite at the finish. Very good brew.
Bottle thanks to Newgeneric from BA. Great body and head. Smells like a wet dream. Amazing. Fresh even after two months. Nice hopiness but not overbearing.
Full citrus nose and flavor, balanced with tart and sweet citrus with a nice malt backbone. Nice dry finish

Lots of grapefruit tropical fruit orange and herbal hop notes on top of caramel and some toast. Pours darker than expected with a nice oily creamy head. Nice citrus flavors lots of grapefruit orange juicy fruit and some pot with caramel and toasted malt. Balanced but resinous finish. Good shit.
Pours an orange color, bubbly white head. Aroma is loaded with grapefruit, wildflower honey, herbal notes. Flavor is very juicy with hops, bitter citys peel. Badass!!!

Date: July 24, 2010
Mode: Growler
Source: Tasting
Appearance: cloudy dark yellow, frothy off white head, dripy lace
Aroma: big sweet citrus aroma
Flavor: sweet hop flavor, touch of citrus, pale malt sweetness, long bitter finish
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 14/20
Rating: 3.5/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *** /4

Hooked up from IrishBoy, a million thanks to your generosity as always. A little darker than expected caramel color pour with a nice sized pillowy head floating on top. Huge resinous pine hop notes are mixed well with some tropical fruit and more dank dank dank. Flavor is a bit more malt forward than I figured. Aggressively bitter finish, great carbonation for the style. Very nice.

Bomber filtered through coffee filter after the top of the bottle broke while being opened.  Pours a hazy dark orange with some amber highlights.  HUGE fucking aroma on this bad boy.  Big grass, grapefruit, tropical fruit, and bubblegum notes.  Holy shit! After I was taken back by the aroma, I expected a ton of hop presence in the body, which ended up being more malt forward.  Sweet caramel malt, mangos, peaches, and bubblegum make up the body without any real bitterness.  Fruity as all hell.  A little lighter body, with a tad of bitterness would be nice, but Im not complaining or anything.

Bottle from thome50, and shared with mtjoseph.  Slightly hazy, caramel color with a small white head.  Big aroma with loads of citrus and pineapple, some cotton candy-like sweetness, slight floral notes.  Smells amazing!  Taste is big caramel notes, some grapefruit which lends a small amount of bitterness towards the finish.  This bottle may be past its prime, as all Im getting loads of caramel and a slight bitterness.   The aroma is phenomenal, so I would love to revisit this in case it is just past its prime.

Bottle - 22oz.  Cracked the bottle and was immediately greeted with an explosion of pine (Columbus and Citra?) and mango (Amarillo?). Citra pours a mildly hazy, beautiful sunset-orange. Boasts a perfect, not-too-foamy long-lasting head which acts as a cushion, softening the landing into that crisp co2 mouth-feel and immediate hop bite. HUGE aroma; Grass, pine, grapefruit, mango, bubblegum, honey, feet, and a hint of fat people BO. Smells a bit like the Christmas tree in my living room. What stands out of me is how medium-bodied this is, much more full and chewy than most imperial IPAs released lately,  which are typically much thinner. Flavor is very similar to its aroma, minus the fruit; and not to my surpise ... not very bitter. Tastes "green," bringing to the table grass, pine, and a hint of oxidation (which comes with every IPA not consumed within 5 minutes of bottling). There is recognizable caramel malt character and sweetness grounding that hop flavor explosion, all while still allowing it to go out and play, much like a parent telling their teenage daughter she needs to be in by midnight. Finishes clean with zero off-flavors. This thing is dry-hopped so much that you can actually feel the hop oil coating your mouth after each sip.  Overall, this is great stuff. Worthy of a GABF gold? ... perhaps. Lives up to its hype, even though the bottle I have is weeks old since bottling. I could only imagine what it tastes like fresh from the source. Road trip?

22 oz. bottle courtesy of IrishBoy - A two week old bottle.  Pours a hazy amber color with a one finger thick off white head.  Light spotty lacing.  Aroma is big floral and citrus hops.  Flavor is floral and citrus hops with a little malt sweetness trying to brake through. Finish is smooth and not overly bitter.  Medium body.  An excellent 2IPA.  Thanks Richard.

Draft at GABF. Im not sure if I just got a bad pour or what, but this seemed old. Pours an attractive orangey gold with a fluffy white head and hop haze. Nose is distinctly citra with mango and apricot. Then there is a distinct caramel note and some cardboard. Taste is much the same. Big hops but they fall flat. Lots of juicy citrus and then caramel. Just doesnt seem as advertised. Lacks the pop I would expect from this beer. Okay.

Great DIPA coming from a non-hophead.  Gold pour.  Citra hop explosion on the nose and taste along with tons of citrus type fruits.  Should be real good with sushi.  I can see why this won gold at the 2011 GABF.

24 karat pour infused with tangerine, orange and peach hues.  1/4 inch ivory foam that spotted the glass with lacing.  Tropical nose of mango, guava, and papaya accompanied by more traditional citrus, pine, and cracked red pepper.  Grapefruit pith, orange peel, and lemon zest are followed by evergreen, honey and caramel.  Medium mouthfeel.  Pretty damn good.

Sample from growler shared by a BA.  Pours a hazy golden amber color with a medium sized white head.  The aroma had a big pungent hop presence that included strong citrus, herbal, catty and some resiny notes.  The flavor had a nice malty base that had moderate sweetness.  The hops were still dominant with herbal, citrus and resiny notes.  This was very drinkable and a touch less bitter than I usually want from my DIPAs, but still an enjoyable experience.
@ gabf Pours clear gold. Candied Citrus peel aroma with a little cut grass. Palate is perfectly balanced-rich yet very hoopy & green. Excellent

Bottle thanks to Peter!. Pours cloudy gold with cream white head. Nose/taste of pineapple, mango, citrus, pine and caramel malt. Smooth and creamy hops with lots of pineapple and citrus and a semi dry pine and mango finish. Wonderful world class pineapple and tropical fruit nose falls a little short on the taste. Medium body.

Super happy to have been able to try this one. Pours an orange/yellow with a light white head. Aroma is Tropical fruits, mango, guava. Taste is sweet makt at first and then strangely sweet hops, I know its a hop bomb but the bitterness is so easy. Palate is nice and think for and IPA. Overall this is incredibly refreshing for a DIPA. I was sorry to see the bottom of my glass on this one.

my 2nd bottle of this amazing beer, Id love to find more. This is such a fantastic beer, its stuff like this that just makes me want to only drink beer for days on end! The aroma is hugely floral and aromatic- poured into my Stone IPA glass, its a beautiful dark yellow/light orange color, the head laced then fades quickly. Taste is insane - like having mango/grapefruit juice infused with some bitterness and carbonation. It is such a citrus bomb of a beer, I LOVE it. I would like to taste this side by side with a fresh batch of their 5th anniversary, which I think I liked even more than this amazing beer. Kern River knows how to make IPAs!! Great beer!

A - Pours a slightly hazy golden-copper color with a finger of frothy white head atop. The head fades down slowly leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is bursting with lots of citrus hops. Lots of pineapple, orange, and mango here. There is also just enough sweet caramel malt in the background to balance.

T - Starts off with lot of citrus hops with again, lots of pineapple, orange, and mango flavors. There is also some nice bitterness in the background. Through the middle, the hops just keep on building with the bitterness and there is just enough sweet caramel malts to balance. The finish is a mix of citrus hops and bitterness with again a nice balance of caramel malts that linger for quite some time.

M - Medium-plus bodied with moderate carbonation. The beer feels very smooth with some nice dryness from all the hop flavor and bitterness.

D - Very drinkable. The hop flavor is quite strong throughout, but the malt and the body really keep up very nicely to create a strongly hopped, but balanced beer.

Bottle.  Pours caramel/honey orange in color with a small but frothy white head.  Aroma is massive tropical fruit (pineapple, mango), pine, and medium hop bitterness in the very back.  The most tropical fruit forward IIPA Ive ever smelled.  Taste does not meet the expectation of the aroma.  Taste is heavy malt (even a bit sweet), a bit of pine, and some bitterness through the finish.  Even feel in the mouth.  Very nice, perfectly drinkable IIPA but a notch below my personal favorites in the style.
Bottle...  Poured vibrant orange with a thick white head. Obviously dominated by citrus hop flavors. Oily, pepper-spiced, piney, and a resinous bitterness.

Bottle saved for me by Jazz at El Cerito, thanks a TON!  Pours a great orange with a frothy white head.  The aroma is full of pineapple through and through.  Mango and other tropical fruit round it out for a great citrus hop bouquet.  The taste, West Coast DIPA!! There is loads of citra hop with some bitterness but this one is balanced beyond belief.  I keep coming back to the mango and tropical fruit.  Overall, they know how to do a DIPA better than almost anyone else.  Hope they can make this a regular offering.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: hay, citrus, golden, clear, white foam, lightly bitter, oily feel, light body, average carbonation, just.a.great.ipa.highly.recommend

Bottle thanks to a new trade partner. Beautiful orange with excellent sticky lace. Great citra dankness, and leafy plant like hop matter. Good tropical passion fruit flavor and resinous hop dank and citrus and sticky sap. Bitter finish. Fantastic.

Thanks Urcancaver for sharing multiple samples from a growler.  Bright and lively orange pour with a fluffy white head.  Loads of lace.  Aroma is tropical fruit.  Citra Bomb, resinous, mango, papaya Awesome

The aroma is unbelievable - smooth citrus grapefruit and tangerine notes. The beer pours amber with an orange hue and white head. The flavor is so smooth with perfect citrus hops on top and no booze notes at all. So refreshing with no bite at all or being overcarbonated.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2011 One of the best Imperial IPAs I have had. The aroma is full of tropical fruit notes with little bitterness on the nose. The appearance is a golden color with a slight haze to it. The tastes follows the aroma very closely. The bitterness is not over the top, but it is a very west coast style DIPA. One of my favorites for sure.

Update from after trying the beer on tap at the Citra release. This beer is very well made and it was a pleasure meeting the whole team out on Kernville. I thought the ticket system they used was very efficient for those who were there early enough to receive an allocation, and I will happily make my way back out there in the future

Bottle.  Clear golden pour with a nice white head.  Tropical fruit & citrusy hop aromas.  The taste pretty much follows suit with peach, orange, mango, pineapple, and pine notes supported by a muted caramel malt backbone.  Light and refreshing..

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 Fresh growler courtesy of tkunkel. many thanks man!

A: Dark copper-orange-amber body. Large, off-white head formed from a sizable stream of carbonation from the bottom of the glass. Good retention holds the head up for a few minutes before crashing to a nice skim and a well-defined ring. Nice coating of lacing, not sheets, but significant coverage.

S: Tropical fruits like mango, pineapple, grapefruit and orange dominate up front. A nice resinous quality. Freshly baked biscuits and bread. Some zesty spice. I also was getting a hint of caramelized brown sugar. Very interesting. Tons of hops, but a sizable malt base.

T: Like the nose there are massive doses of hops and malt here in the flavor profile. The hops are pronounced with mango and grapefruit separating themselves from the rest of the citric notes. Lots of sweet, freshly baked baked goods. 

M: Creamy, medium body with good rolling carbonation. Resinous and oily. Solid bitterness throughout culminating with a nice aggressive bite. 

O: All around interesting and enjoyable dIPA. Combines the freshness of west coast style dIPAs with the sweet bakery like malt of big, east coast IPAs.

Got  this beer at Vendome Beverly Hills.. They got the  best selection In LA
I love the way this beer smells. Its all tropical--pineapple,mango,peach,tangerin and mandarin oranges. Has a little orange zest in the smell as well-- real strong on all tropical citrus notes. No real malt in the smell just pure hop bliss.Very crisp clean and fruity DIPA. Very easy drinkability with amazing flavors but the best part of this beer is the nose. This is hands down the best DIPA I have ever had
22oz bottle. Rating #60. Clear golden/orange color with a nicely lacing white head. Nice aroma, tropical fruits and citrus. Very smooth, more citrus and a nice little aftertaste, really tasty. (1871)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Grab a bottle at Stearns Liquor down in Long Beach. Thanks Stearns Liquor for always getting this amazing brews. I open up the bottle and there is an amazing aroma that is very strong on pineaple, grapefruit, and citra hops. It pours light copper with 2 inches of white foam. You get alot of citra hops in the taste and lots orange, grapefrui and some bitterness. There was also some buttery notes that I did not enjoy but that vanished as I was finishing the bottle. Finishes a bit bitter with a bit of caramel malt. Pretty dry. The mouthfeel is medium thick, very smooth, and has a nice carbonation. Overall a great beer but I was excpecting Pliny standards. I would love to have it again. Maybe on tap, I though Just outstanding was much better on tap then on bottle so maybe this is to, not sure.

Thanks to whoever brought this to the Inaugural "Imminent Liquidation Bottle Share" Event. Growler poured into a taster glass.

A - Pours deep amber orange with a small half finger tall white head, dissipating down to almost nothing, leaving light lacing down the glass.

S - HUGE citric hop punch up front that never really fades from the limelight. Some caramel malt and tropical fruits offer as much balance as they can but it is really all about the hops.

T - Still plenty of citric hops up front; just not as much as the nose; giving way slowly to a mix of light caramel malt and fresh tropical fruits. Finish is quite bitter but it doesnt last for very long. I really like this one. It is not too over the top like others, it is quite refreshing actually. Glad I finally got to try it.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Nice crisp feel with a good amount of lingering hop bitterness in the finish.

D - Dangerously high. I finally get to try this one on for size. I really enjoyed the Hill Farmstead Citra but I think the Kern River was a bit more well rounded. I hope to have this again someday, preferably on-tap!

Courtesy of MrBubbler  thanks, Adam! Prepared to be let down given the hype surrounding this beer, but its glorious. Full orange body with a mild cloudiness, abundant carbonation, and medium lacing. Nose of sharp grassy hops with a very slight sweetness. Mouthfeel is thick and crisp, just right for a brew which  like this one  gets close to PtE. The taste follows this trajectory but with more sweet PushUps flavors, ala Alpine Duet, and this makes for a rad hybrid and a super good WC DIPA.

On tap in sample size at the 2011 Bistro DIPA Fest. Pours a hazy golf with a dense white froth. Malty brown sugar and candied lemon hops on the nose with a piney accent. Flavor is lemon zest with a light pale malt note. I appreciate the hop focus without a syrupy malt profile but it also is allowing a soapy astringent note to come through. Solid bitterness but not really up to DIPA standards. A good beer but Im not buying the hype here.
growler thanks to bu11zeye.  poured yellow/gold with a white head.  aroma and flavor were grapefruit, citrus, and pine with a light body.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 Growler pour. Golden pour with some white head. Pine citrus dominated flavor, some herbal and dank tones but really sessionable for an dipa. Nice

Growler.  Pours a honey golden body with a white head.  Soft and herbal, hemp and very weedy.  The hop character takes a very grass and earth y tone.  Not really juicy sweeter like some of the other dipas from the west coast.  Light citrus, soft and herbal, very sticky and bittering.  Light resins, nice offering.

I had this on tap and fell in love with. From the start, I could smell this beer all day and be happy, but getting to drink it is amazing. Very nice balanced color and taste, not too heavy, amd closer to what I would say a seesion ipa is. The citra hops come out in full force and will leave you wanting more. The brewers are also super cool and down to earth.

Massive grapefruit aroma. Hazy orange, copper with a full white head. Starts off slightly watery, but continues with medium-full warming mouthfeel.  Malt holds up nicely for this hop bomb. Citrus and grapefruit.  Bitterness throughout.

Bistro DIPA fest 2011.  Pours a light orange golden with a thin lasting sticky white head.  Powerful orange tangerine citra hops, pine resin some sap, and light spicy weed.  Flavor is lgith crackery- just tons of resinous citra hops, orange zest, lemon, tangerine spiciness and oily although the finish is a bit drier than most- less sappy sticky sweet than some, very easy drinking and very fresh.  One of the top 5 of the fest.  Awesome!

Bistros DIPA fest in Hayward, CA. liked this one a bit at first and was then practically forced to retry, ended up one of my favorite of the day with multiple trips. an almost witlike hazy yellow pour, Big citrus flavor of tangerine, grapefruit orange. Citrus dominated. resiny hops, geat flavor, seemed bigger than 8%. real nice
Resin and grapefruit nose. Orangey golden. Light body, a little candy malt, lots of citrus notes as advertised.  Totally satisfying.

Tasted on tap at the 11th Bistro Double IPA Festival on 2/12/2011. This Imperial India Pale Ale pours a slightly hazy yellow gold color from the tap. Medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is citrusy, tangerine and grapefruit. A medium bodied Double IPA. The malts are fruity and sweet, orange, tangerine and citrus. The hops are grapefruit and citrus. Nice balance. Decent carbonation. Medium bitterness, lots of citrusy flavors. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter and citrusy.

Growler pour courtesy of bu11zeye. Clear pale amber color/ ivory head. Big grass, cat piss, ganja aromas. medium bodied. Nice mix of sweet honey, caramel malty flavors with grass, bitter grapefruit, and pine hoppage.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
Poured into a snifter.

4.0 A: Hazy dark orange color. Two fingers of thick, creamy off-white head. Good retention and plenty of spotty lacing.

5.0 S: Big hop explosion like a fresh Hopslam, but without the malty backbone. Absolutely tons and tons of orange, apricot, candied mango, grapefruit and a host of other tropical fruits. Slightly yeasty, and you can tell the malts are there, but they get lost in the wonderful hops.

4.5 T: Again, the hops deliver. Grapefruit and pine take over in the taste. Moderate, but soft bitterness. Lots of orange, peach, and tropical fruit. Yeasty again, but barely noticeable compared to the other flavors. Malts give a touch of sweetness to balance and not much else.

5.0 M: Heavier medium body, not the shitty watery like many west coast IPAs. This is just how I like my DIPAs. Wonderfully creamy and a bit chewy.

5.0 D: I wasnt sure if this would live up to the hype, but I was pleasantly surprised. This is definitely an elite DIPA. I just wish it was a bit easier for me to get. No flaws and lots of great qualities.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 08-09-2010 23:13:01

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2011 Sample at the brewpub. The beer is a slightly hazed amber-orange color with a medium white head that recedes steadily. Rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, grassy hops and malt. Medium body with a moderately bitter hops character that has notes of grapefruit and spruce. The finish is hoppy with a citrusy aftertaste. Pretty solid overall.

(Growler thanks to bu11zeye) clear rich gold, nice lace. Nose of pineapple, orange, bit of onion and mango. Taste a bit of umami, quite bitter, decent balance, orange, grapefruit. Soft carbonation, oily body with a bitter linger.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2011 (Growler, via trade with BMan1113VR & a 22oz bottle)  Pours a lightly hazy golden body with a medium white head.  Aroma of grass, cow manure, grapefruit, grain, and pine.  Flavor of pine, citrus, dank, herbs, grass, and earth with a dry, bitter finish.

Growler. Courtesy of maltzilla. Poured into a tulip glass a slightly cloudy orange amber color with a slightly off white head head that laces nicely as it settles. Aroma is that of tropical fruit like mango mixed with citrus. Malty start gives way to a very strong hop profile that lingers on and has nice flavors of citrus and fruit. Nicely done and well blended.
growler, thanks to bu11zeye, color of clear golden and bubbly foam, aroma is sweaty citrics, flavors of orange juice, pineapples and a metallic bitter finish

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2010 Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this growler. 

The beer pours a golden color with a white head. The aroma definitely screams Double IPA. I get a lot of resiny hops, but there is also quite a bit of orange citrus mixed in. I dont get much, if any malt in the aroma. 

The flavor is a hop explosion. The first hops that I get are resiny and piney, but then the fruit comes in. I get a ton of different fruit flavors. Among them are pineapples, oranges and mangos. I also get some biscuit malt mixed in to keep the bitterness at a low to medium level. 

Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. 

Excellent.

Growler with big thanks to BMan1113VR.  Poured a clear, honey colored body with soapy off-white head that was lasting and left good lacing.  BAM!!!  Holy Shit!!  A grapefruit explosion on and in the nose.  A lush combination of both sweet Ruby Red flesh and the zest.  Orange and melon comes in later.  Flavors were grapefruit, oranges, orange zest, melon, pineapple and a great medium lingering bitter finish.  Lively carbonation and a slick mouthfeel.  Id love to come across more of this.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 Huge, huge thanks to Solomon420 for getting me out a "growler" of this.

A: Pours a beautiful slightly-hazed apricot color with a very nice
white head and plenty of lacing.

S: Incredible. Absolutely floored by the fruit presence here. Immense aroma of peach, apricot, and a bit of mango. Other tropical fruits as well. At this point, the Citra hops can do no wrong.

T: Not quite as good as the nose, but still extremely delicious. The fruit just pops; there is some bitterness in the background, but not really too much. Similarly, no real malt presence. This is just pure hop flavor and aroma.

M: Medium body with good carbonation and quite smooth.

D: Immensely drinkable, especially for the style. The 8.0%abv does not come through at all. Its simply plenty of delicious hop flavor with a slightly bitter edge to it. While this might not be nearly as bitter as other West Coast beers of the same style, the flavor is just unbeatable; I dont care what the style is.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 06-02-2010

APPEARANCE: 
On tap at Downtown Johnny Browns. Pours a cloudy orange color with big white head. The lacing is insane.
AROMA: 
Huge mango and passion fruit smells more like juice than beer
FLAVOR: 
Orange and sugar cookies to start, then candied orange peel, the tropical flavors to finish.
MOUTHFEEL:
Medium body but finishes a bit thin. That is my biggest complaint.
DRINKABILITY: 
Extremely drinkable but this tastes more like a soda than beer. I find it hard to believe that there is any alcohol in there.

Peach pour with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is intensely fruity, pineapple, mango, papaya, a bit of orange citrus as well/grapefruit.  Nice bitter hops as well, very resinous.  Craemy mouthfeel leads to more fruity hop delight.  Robust grapefruit hop notes with intense resin bitterness.  Playful fruitiness compliments this nicely.  Damn good

Sampled from Toronado during SDBW. Golden orange color with a thin head. The aromas of this beer were great with lemon, orange, tangerine. Full bodied and chewable with great balance of bitter hoppy resinous bitterness. Long finish with tasty earthy bitter sweetness. Could drink this anytime.

Served on tap at Downtown Johnny Browns. The appearance is a cloudy orange peach hue with a big lacing and lasting white head. The aromas are full of rich hops full of grapefruit ring, mango, orange cream. The flavors follow with a crazy creamy orange, floral, mango, and grapefruit concoction. The mouth is wonderfully creamy with a lighter carbonation. Full bodied and delicious. Ive felt the last few weeks that DIPAs were loosing favor with but right when Im about to get out I get pulled right back in. What a great brew.

I could just smell this beer and be happy.  lemon and tropical fruit everywhere on the aroma.  Just marvelous.  I dont know how they topped the Just Outstanding IPA.  The taste is light and fruity with just the right bitter touch at the end.

Draft @ obriens:  cloudy tangerine color, thin sheet of froth...smells like a fruit cocktail...some stewed peaches, canned pears...you know, dat kinda shit.  Flavors are fruity and bubbly, fruits popping out here and there...decent, certainly clean with a satisfying dryness...but its dipa...how interesting and enjoyable can it be?  Decent. Yeah.

Taste thanks to Chris!murky tea-colored, bubbly beige head. Buttery dough, heavy grapefruit. Very fresh, stinging hop nose. Doughy flavor, up front and then in the back, lots of grapefruit and stinging mint in the middle. Sticky, lightly coating, a little bitter and salty. Nice fresh profile and nice balance in the flavor, but where PtE has a hop depth, even when over-aged, this is straightforward hop-fruit.

Absolutely fantastic beer.   I had a few glasses of this beer and was just blown away.  I really didnt expect it to live up to the hype, but I was happily wrong on that score.  It has easily the best Citra flavor in the 10 or so Citra IPAs Ive tried so far.  It was all very bright floral and tangerine notes.  The beer is quite well made.  Just enough light malt sweetness to carry the hops.  Finishes mildly dry and refreshing.  Little to no harshly bitter notes.  This is a very easy beer to like and makes me want to make the long drive down to Kernville.

Growler thanks to billshmeinke. Pours with a huge white head that slowly starts to recede over a hazy golden body. The head leaves behind excellent lacing, as does each sip. Nose is huge, citrus, tropical fruits, mango, papaya, lychee. Taste is papaya, mango, strawberry, tones of fruit with a bit of caramel on the finish. Well attenuated, medium carbonation. A great DIPA!!!

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2010 Big thanks to PeaceLoveBear for this one!

A-pours a dirty murky brown liquid with dark orange edges with a fair amount of dirty white head that leaves a ton of lacing.

S-the nose has this buttery dough with caramel malt base up front, same as the just outstanding IPA, tons of hops take ever, lots of bitter pine, citrus hops galore, big in the nose.

T-the taste has a very light doughy flavor, notes of caramel, syrupy pine, tons of citrus in the back, grapefruit mostly, moderate bitterness that is quite pleasant and doesnt linger or sting the back of the tongue.

M-medium bodied, a little syrupy, creamy up front with lots of carbonation giving it a somewhat grainy feel in the back.
