D-this has a big balance of malt and hop, the citrus comes in nicely and the bitterness is moderate.  not as huge as I thought this was going to be nor as hoppy.  the balance was very nice and I actually really enjoy this buttery dough flavor their IPAs have had.  Very solid IPA, not Pliny but darn good!

Growler shared by Maltzilla. Pours orangish golden color with off white head. Aromas of grapefruit and other citrus fruits. Sweet grapefruit and caramel flavors. Medium body with average carbonation. Very Nice. Thanks Diego.

Thanks to Kev - 

Appearance: Pours a cloudy peach with a creamy cap of foam.

Aroma: Humongous, mind blowing tangerine, dank, mango passion fruit and funk.

Taste: Bitter, danky that some how fades down to tame citrus. No sign of booze.

Mouthfeel:  Full bodied, fizzy.

Overall:  One of my favorite styles in general, this was amazingly dry hopped, easy to drink, and not boozy at all.
Growler sample. Pours orange/tan with a medium white head. Aroma and Flavor are a magical blend of citrus fruits and hops. Medium bodied with a pinch and a little warmth. Damn good.

4 oz sample. Pours a golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malty hops with citrus and grapes complementing. Awesome taste with citrus and sweet oak. Just awesome. Palate is good with medium moutfeel and excellent finish. Overall a really good beer

A friend of a friend brought a growler of this, unfortunately, I do not remember her name.  Aroma has piney, grapefruit, mango, citrus hop aromas present with a nice, balanced sweetness.  Pretty damn fruity nose.  Mostly hazy golden orange body with a large, frothy white head that leaves really nice white lacing.  Citrus passionfruit flavors dominate the start with a little pineapple, too.  This is just exploding with hops.  This also has a really nice sweet malty backbone, which stands up to the hops nicely, leaving a really balanced and drinkable beer.  Finishes with some piney hop flavors.  This is really juicy.  I like.

Growler opened on the 4th of July thanks to my homie, Gorefiendus! Muchos gracis! Split with friends into tasting glasses. 

A - Pours a hazy golden/copper color, white head, lots of bubbles here and there, good lacing/retention, nice cap on top. A really nice looking DIPA we have here.

S - Hops, dankness, floral notes, light citrus zest. Lots of stuff going on here, but overall, a lot of hops and citrus. Not as overwhelming and in-your-face as I was expecting, which I like. Its subtle yet you know its all there...so good.

T - Similar to the nose. Dank hops, floral notes, lemon/lime zest, grapefruit. Not too powerful, just right. This is a monster, but very well done. Really enjoying the hops and citrus...nice! Citrus/bitter finish.

M - Medium bodied, sticky on the palate, decently dry finish and very crisp and clean.

D - So so good, worthy of its rank on here. I didnt think this one was going to be so good, but I was wrong. I drank several glasses out of the growler...probably a large majority of it. I want more!

A: The pour is a very nice looking golden copper color with a mild haze and a white head.

S: A big blast of citrusy and fruity hops fills the nose. Lots of grapefruit, lemon, and tropical fruits. Pineapple and mango balance quite nicely with a mild bready malt and pine.

T: A lot of hop fruitiness and a solid bread base. Up front, there is a nice grapefruit, pineapple, and mango. A bit of bready malt in the middle and a great bitterness on the finish.

M: The body is medium with a mild to moderate level of carbonation.

D: A really nice and easy drinking DIPA. I didnt notice the somewhat high ABV at all. Thanks for the chance to try this one, Damian.
On tap at Stone Bistro.  Dark golden pour, white head.  Citrus, grapefruit, light sweet malt, pineapple, and fresh hops.  Nice hop centered IIPA, not overly balanced though.

Huge thanks to Joe for sharing this growler!

Pours a bright hazy golden yellow with a small soapy white head that shows good retention and a bit of lacing.

The aroma is full of juicy sweet citrus fruits - oranges and pineapples.  Maybe a bit of floral pine but its mostly the citrus hops.  There is a light crisp pale malt presence as well.

The taste is more of the same with the massive juicy citrus hops dominating from the start.  Theres a solid bready malt backbone which gives way to a bitterness in the end, partly from citrus but also from a bit of resinous pine hops.

The mouthfeel is medium bodied with good carbonation.  Extremely crisp with a slightly dry finish.

This is a great DIPA and has a ton of flavor but is insanely drinkable.  Glad to have the opportunity to try this one.

On tap at brewery 05/21/10. Visited KRBC after a 3 hour rafting trip. Poured a deep orange with fluffy white head. Aroma is amazing, smells of citrus and mangos. Full body with excellent carbonation. Taste is of citrus hops with a hint of mango and grapefruit left on the pallet. Excellent DIPA especially for such a small brewery.

Big props to Jose for hooking me up here.

Pours a hazy dark honey gold with hints of orange. About two fingers of head rises, good sign with a growler, but it fades pretty quickly, Light lacing.

The aroma is kind of light but its nice. Good balance of light sweet citrus on the front with a pronounced but mellow hoppiness. The hops are present throughout, light pine.

The taste is super malty for an ipa, grapefruit, pineapple, light hop finish, a little pine on the very end.

The feel is ok, easy drinker.

Overall, this is interesting, tasty and easy to drink. However, not much of an ipa let alone a double ipa. Doesnt have a ton of hops, so thats a little of a let down. If it was just a bit more hoppy to balance out the malt it would be awesome.

Kern river citra dipa. big thanks to richard for supplying the growler!...growler opened up with a hiss. Pours a golden  
gloat orange brown with a frothy white head... Vibrant hoppy aroma of  
some dank green hop and an abundance of sweet tropical and citrusy  
hops. A little sugary malt to merge with the aforementioned hops...  
Flavors are malty and tropical sweet forward with an earthiness to  
it.  Sweet overall wish it had somewhat more of a bitter bite to it  
but still nice nonetheless.
9/4/8/3/15

Growler from IrishBoy, thanks Dad!  Peach/amber, foggy with a hint of gold, off white head.  Aroma is strong citrus, lime, grapefruit, fruit punch, orange peel... Smells like crunkjuice!  Taste is a nice hoppy background, citrus, mild caramel, nicely malted.  Nice stuff!

Growler shared by Mike.  Thanks Mike!!  Pours orange with white head.  Aroma is citrus and pine.  Medium mouthfeel.  Flavor is lip smack puckering, tart, juicy, grapefruit rind, and finishes with a touch of tart pineapple.  This was my first brew that I know of that uses Citra hops.  Great stuff.  Thanks Mike!!

Growler shared by Kan.  This was a very nice surprise.  Pour is a really dense looking, and quite cloudy yellow.  Aroma is massive grapefruit, with hints of pineapple, and a light pine component too.  Really a very enticing aroma.  Flavor is also huge grapefruit hops with background notes of pine and pineapple.  Flavor also has a fair amount of malty sweetness that kind of curtail the hop experience a little.  I really liked this.
Growler thanks kan, pours gazed gold with white head. Nose has fresh citruy grapefruit, flavors of grapefruit, orange citrus, long mellow grapefruit juice finish. This is grapefruit juice.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2010 Growler shared by chswimmer on BA.  Pours hazy golden with a nice one-finger off-white head and good retention.  Really citrusy hop aroma - grapefruit and orange - with sweet malt and some vegetable notes.  Flavor is orange and grapefruit, some veggies and resinous hops.  Just a little malt character.  Nice palate, a real wrecker.  Medium-full body.  Pretty good overall, drinkable.

Hand bottle from Irishboy.  Thanks, Richard!Pours a deep, dense cheddar orange with an aroma of cat urine and grapefruit, with touches of cheddar cheese malt.  Flavor is a nice, rosy grapefruit with a subtle undertone of sweet malt and red cherries.  Nice, slippery mouthfeel.  Smells funny but tastes pretty good.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text:
UPDATED: OCT 6, 2011 3/7/2010 5/3/7/3/15, 3.3 
Handbottle shared by Eric 
Appearance: Pours a hazy golden straw with a white head, leaving some lacing 
Aroma: The beer was oxidized so the aroma was pretty bad 
Taste: Very nice taste of citrus & floral hops 
A very nice tasting beer. I hope to be able to try a fresh one sometime. 
Re-Rate 9/30/2011 
GABF 2011, finally I get a chance to re-rate this beer.
Aroma and taste is tropical fruit, floral and light caramel 
Very nice.

Handbottle thanks to Richard and Eric. Pours a somewhat clear yellow color with a thick white head. The aroma is interesting; massive citrus, signs of oxidation unfortunately. The flavor was nice though; rich well balanced sweet hops, not aggressive, but mellow, with a nice malty background. Very easy to drink. Not bad, but not the best sample Im sure. Still, it was a treat to get to try this.

(big thanks to irishboy for the hand bottled sample)awesome cloudy orange body with a nice white head that leaves lacing.the aroma cant be beat.citurs,pine,fresh wet hops,and a small malt backbone.flavor is much of the same.very easy drinking and refreshing for a double ipa,but it still has all the flavor.
On tap at Toronado SD.  Holy crap.  Aroma is akin to opening a bag of fresh, dank Humboldt Marijuana.  Flavor is a blast of big, juicy hops.  Kill me now and bury me in a casket full of this stuff.

On tap at Bistro DIPA Fest poured a cloudy golden yellow with a lasting off white head. Aromas of peach, cookie, orange, tropical fruit and light pink grapefruit. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of peach, cookie, tropical fruit and orange with a crisp dry fruity finish.

Draguht at Bistros 10th DIPA festival.   Hazy looking gold pour with a thick head.   Super fresh floral hops and soft pine in the aroma.   The flavor is very hop forward without being really bitter or sweet.   Very soft and smooth with excellent drinkability.   Lots of tropical fruit and pine flavors with a touch of malt.   Like Ken said, creamy.   A standout of the fest for sure.

Draft @ The Bistro. Pours a hazy, golden color; fluffy white head with excellent retention and fine-bubbled lacing; tiny bubbles, beautiful pour. Loads of dry, grassy and herbal hop character in the aroma; nicely resiny and dry; dank; strongly reminiscent of herb. Medium-to-full body: creamy, softly textured mouthfeel despite the lively carbonation; nicely dry core (light malt sugars, hint of crystal?) surrounded by layers of luscious, dank hop character: herbal, citrus, non-astringent; awesome, creamy DIPA. Lasting, dry and toasty finish: consistently smooth.

Draft at the Bistro DIPA Fest at 11AM, my first beer and favorite of the fest. Murky yellow orange with a medium pale yellowish head. Nose jumps out hoppy tones of pine and ivy. Flavor is bitter, bitter, and more bitter with background caramel undertones. Superb new beer; cant wait to get to the brewpub next week for a growler.
